verses.roman:
dui bhāire rāghava āni' pariveśe
yatna kari' khāoyāya, nā rahe avaśeṣe

synonyms: dui bhāire—to the two brothers; rāghava—Rāghava paṇḍita; āni'-bringing; pariveśe—distributed; yatna kari'-with great attention; khāoyāya—fed Them; nā rahe avaśeṣe—there were no remnants.
translation: Rāghava Paṇḍita would bring and distribute prasāda to the two brothers, feeding Them with great attention. They ate everything, and therefore there were no remnants left.
